net.sourceforge.waters.model.compiler.efa

Class EFACompiler

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.sourceforge.waters.model.compiler.AbortableCompiler
      • net.sourceforge.waters.model.compiler.efa.EFACompiler
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    net.sourceforge.waters.model.analysis.Abortable

    public class EFACompiler
extends AbortableCompiler

    The third pass of the ModuleCompiler.

    This compiler accepts a module (ModuleProxy) as input and produces another module as output. It expands all guard/action blocks by partitioning the events, and replaces all variables by simple components. Event arrays, event aliases, foreach constructs, and instantiations are not allowed in the input. Constant alias declarations are only parsed to collect enumeration atoms. All these constructs should be expanded by a previous call the the module instance compiler (ModuleInstanceCompiler).

    The EFA compiler ensures that the resultant module only contains nodes of the following types:

    • EventDeclProxy, where only simple events are defined, i.e., the list of ranges is guaranteed to be empty;
    • SimpleComponentProxy.

    Algorithm

    The EFA compiler proceeds in four passes:

    1. Identify all components (simple or variable) and their state space.
    2. Collect and normalise guards, and identify the event variable set for each event.
      The event variable set consists of the set of all variables whose value may change if an event occurs. It can be computed in two different ways, depending on the configuration.
      In AUTOMATON_ALPHABET mode, the event variable set of an event is the set of all the variables updated in some simple component using the event.
      In EVENT_ALPHABET mode, the event variable set of an event is the set of all the variables updated in some guard/action block whose edge includes the event.
    3. Compute event partitionings.
    4. Build output automata.
    Author:
    Robi Malik, Roger Su
